title: Black Forest Potato Soup (Schwarzwalder Kartoffelsuppe)
ingredients: 1 pound potatoes, peeled, halved, and sliced
½ pound green beans, cut into 1-inch pieces
½ celery root, peeled and sliced
2 cups brown stock, or beef broth
instructions: In a large kettle or stockpot combine all the ingredients, except the chives and parsley, and bring the liquid to a boil.  Skim the froth from the surface and discard.  Once the liquid begins to boil reduce the heat to low and simmer the soup, covered for 1½ hours, or until the meat is tender.
Remove the meat with a slotted spoon and cut it into cubes, and return it to the kettle or stockpot.  Add the chives and parsley and taste the soup to adjust the salt and pepper levels to your taste.
Serve the soup with lightly buttered toast and freshly grated horseradish.
Source:  Cuisines of Germany by Lillian Langseth-Christensen, Gourmet Magazine, June 1973.
